Name: City Lines
Description:
There’s a new mayor in town! And he’s here to change things!
On the order of the day: Privatise transports.
He put together a team to redesign the city’s main lanes, and he now needs enterprising volunteers to achieve it. 
And they only got 4 years to do it!

Each player will represent the CEO of a Private Mass Transport company, trying to achieve high value for their shares in the stock market, and a healthy bank account. The City needs a new transport grid, either with Bus or Metro Lines.
The players will achieve that by building segments of Transport Lines connecting the objectives as dictated by public surveys. Also, the City Hall will come up with special projects, which will be bided by the players.
The game turns are split into Quarters (3 months), in which everyone does their actions. After all players had a turn, the Quarter advances, players receive profit (or not!), and the first player of the Quarter changes (so that everyone can have a quarter in which they are the first to build).
After all Quarters are done, the Year advances and players tally up their accomplishments that year, which will directly impact their Stock Market EOY results.
By the end of the fourth year, the city should be fully networked, and we’ll have a happy Mayor, ready to win the next elections. The player that had the most impact (somehow measured by the value of the shares), will be given the key to the city!

That easy?
Not really. Not everything goes as planned, strange events occur, people lie, politicians cheat…. 
At the beginning of every quarter something will happen that can change a smile into a frown. Or the other way around… 
And there’s also the Influence that such powerful transport tycoons (the players) will have on politics!

Who knows, sometime in four years, you might be the one smiling in front of the cameras holding a golden key to the city!
Or you could be the one already planning for revenge…

Either way, fun is coming your way!

Name: Pur Week-End
Description:
"Pur Week-End" is a French storytelling game in which players must discard cards to tell how awesome their week-end was, while trying to spoil their opponents' week-ends.

The active player makes up a consistent story of his imaginary week-end by playing sets of 3 "Awesome Time" cards with matching symbols (for the time of the day). This could lead to surprising events : try to imagine a morning activity involving "Foam Bath" AND "Practical Joke" AND "Shared Secret"…

Meanwhile, the other players can play "Awful Time" cards to spoil their opponent's good time, as long as they manage to have it make sense with the story. The active player may then defend himself with a special card ("Magical Moment", "Wish Come True" or "Heroic Action"), or even deflect the trouble back with "Revenge".

And if you can't live awesome times on your own, you can always crash other players' events !

The winner is the first player who plays a set of cards for each of the 4 times of the day : morning, afternoon, evening and night.

The game contains 65 "Awesome Times", 18 "Aweful Times", 6 different "Magical Times" and a few special cards.

(Translations of card names in this description are not official)

Name: Draughts for 4
Description:
Originally called 'Dammen voor 4'.

Translated box text:

Checkers for 4 is much more than just checkers: young, old, novice or expert, everybody can play! Play individually or 2-against-2 and prepare for a dynamic family game full of surprises...

1. Everybody's in!
Whether playing with two, three or four players, everybody is in with Checkers for 4! Ideal for families and friends, at home or on holiday.

2. Individual and team play
Go for the challenge: Play individually and go head to head, in pairs with players from different levels or gang up to defeat the so-called 'Checkers King'!

3. Great introduction to checkers
Checkers for 4 is a fun way to get introduced to the game of checkers. The classic rules still apply and you can team up to play against a single experienced player. Learn and win at the same time!

4. A challenge for checkers experts
More opponents from varying levels on a single board requires good analysis, prediction en constantly adapting your style of play. In short, a real challenge for experienced players.

Name: Ladinoscop
Description:
The game consists of 3 Sub-games that are all played on a map of the Ladin valleys. In the very heart of the Dolomites live slightly more than 30.000 Ladins whose identity is characterised mainly by the uniqueness of their language which derives from Vulgar Latin. It is only thanks to the isolation of the splendid high-mountain landscape, in which the Ladins live, that the Ladin language and cultural heritage have survived.

1) Ladinoscop
The objective of the game is to connect the starting point and the arrival point indicated on the route card using the town tokens which lies between.

2) The Dolomite round trip
The objective of this game is to complete the Dolomites round trip by returning to the starting point.

3) Up and down trough Ladinia
The objective of the third game is to reach all the spaces corresponding to the taken town tokens, and finally return to the starting point.

Name: Zookeeper
Description: A cooperative card game about distribution of various animals amongst players.  Players collect sets of animals, but some do not get along with others.  Incomplete sets go to the rival zoo.  The player with the lowest score has to beat the rival zoo in order for everyone to win.

Name: Das Südtirolspiel
Description:
You have to travel trough Südtirol (its a province in the north of Italy) and gather money, possessions and figures.
After fixing the duration of the match and then you start your journey trough the land. 
To gather money you have to answer correctly to trivia cards about Südtirol or just hit the right field, same for possessions.

Easy to learn, fun to play if you live there.

Name: Chrono Cat's
Description:
Chrono Cat's is a French card game about important historical dates : Julius Caesar's victory in Alésia, Charlemagne's coronation, Gutenberg's first press, the discovery of America, the storming of the Bastille, WWI's armistice, the EEC Treaty of Rome.

The game was originally designed to help students to learn 52 important dates for a junior high school exam.
                    
Rules

Each player get a deck of face-down "Event/Cat" cards.
The 52 "Date/Mouse" cards are spread on the table, dates up.

At his/her turn, a player draws a card from his/her deck and reads the event on this card. The other player then try to gain this event card by being the first to slam the matching date card (if no one finds the right date, the event card is just put aside).

When all the event cards have been read, the player with the most cards wins the game.

Name: Fix Mix
Description:
A game for quick eyes and fast fingers.
A player roll the 3 special dice (on with colored squares for the frame, one with colored circles for the background and one with symbols for the item) and everyone must quickly combine the results and try to be the first to point the right tile.

Many variants are possible.

Content :
4 boards
3 special dice
29 chips
1 X chip

Name: Hollywood Domino
Description:
Contents:
95 Hollywood Domino Tiles
Hollywood Star with Platform
Red Carpet
8 Movie Markers
Mr. Hollywood Domino Marker
Scorepad
Rules booklet

Object of the game:  To be the first to "complete your movie" by playing all of your domino tiles.  To win the game, have the lowest total points after 13 rounds of play.

The game is played in 13 rounds beginning in a round that starts with a double 12 and ending in a round that starts with a double 0.  On each turn, players attempt to play one of their domino tiles to match the number of a tile in play either in their own lane (their movie), on the Red Carpet lane (a collaborative movie), or on any lane with an opponent's Movie Marker (to make a "cameo appearance" in that movie).  Special tiles include The Blockbuster which allows a player to place as many tiles as they can in that lane in a single turn, The Stunt Double which allows a player to play any tile of their choosing, and The Comeback which allows the player in posession of this tile at the end of the round to reduce their score to that of the lowest-scoring player for that round.  The player with the fewest points at the end of 13 rounds is the winner.

Name: Rainbow++++
Description:
Most men only distinguish among 11 basic colours (mango, lemon, mandarin, pistachio et al are things you eat, not colours. Oranges are a mere coincidence with the colour).

Rainbow++++ is a fast-paced card game where you must play at least one of each of the 11 possible colours in order to win.

Each colour has a unique special ability that can be good or bad and there is a universal special ability that says that any two played cards of the same colour act as a trump card of the colour of your choice.

The cunning player will carefully choose the sequence of cards to be played as a combo and try to avoid to play cards with a negative special ability.

Name: Operation: Uruzgan – Force on Force in Afghanistan
Description:
A sourcebook for Force on Force: Modern Wargaming Rules 

From the publisher's website:

Written by Leigh Neville, author of the best-selling Osprey Press titles Special Operations Forces in Afghanistan and Special Operations Forces in Iraq, Operation: Uruzgan takes a detailed look at Australian operations in the Uruzgan Province of Afghanistan.

Operation: Uruzgan contains:

* 9 Historically Accurate Scenarios
    * A Historical Overview of Operations in the Region Since Anaconda
    * Special Rules to Represent the Unique Flavor of Taliban Operations in Uruzgan
    * Special Rules to Represent the ADF’s Operations in Uruzgan, Including ROEs and COIN based tactics
    * 5 New Vehicle Write-Ups, including the Bushmaster IMV
    * Uruzgan Specific Fog of War Cards
    * Uruzgan Specific Asset Cards
    * Guidelines for Using Scenarios with Other Coalition Forces

Name: Giant Monster Rampage (Third Edition)
Description:
Have you ever wondered what it would be like to step into your favorite giant monster suit and go on a rampage? Well now's your chance! Giant Monster Rampage is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where giant monsters really exist. The game allows players to create and control one of several different types of monsters, from mutant animals to alien robots and everything in between. Giant Monster Rampage is unique in that it gives players complete control over the creation of their monster. Players can create an existing monster from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless. The object of the game is simply to cause as much damage and destruction as possible.

Giant Monster Rampage is a stand alone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle System™ game.

Name: Power Warriors: Core Rulebook
Description:
Power Warriors is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where an alien race is trying to enslave the Earth. The planet's only hope for survival is a group of young warriors. The game allows players to create and control a mighty warrior trained to fight using the mystical energy of life known as qi. Power Warriors is unique in that it gives players complete control over the creation of their warrior. Players can create an existing warrior from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless. The object of the game is simply to be the last warrior standing.

Power Warriors is a stand alone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle SystemTM game.

Name: Mix 'n' Match
Description:
Mix´n´Match is played on a 7x7 square board.
The board is occupied by stones except the middle cell.
The Mix player must jump on any orthogonal or diagonal direction and capture stones if they are different from each other.
The match player must jump on any orthogonal or diagonal direction and capture stones if they have the same color.
The player that cannot make any valid move,loses.

Name: Jumping Beans
Description:
Jumping Beans is played on a 7x7 square board.
The board is occupied by beans except the middle cell.
Each player starts with 24 beans.
Beans may move to an adjacent empty cell.
Beans capture by jumping over an enemy bean. Capturing is mandatory, and you must keep jumping and capturing as long as it is possible.
A player wins when it captures all enemy beans or when he moves his last remaining bean to the center cell.

Name: Par Golf
Description: Par Golf from National Games published in the 1950's is described on the game cover as a 'fascinating,authentic, new GOLF GAME'.

Name: Chameleons
Description:
Chameleons is played on a 7x7 square board.
The board is occupied by Chameleons except the middle cell.
Each player starts with 24 Chameleons on his color.
A Chameleon may move to any adjacent empty cell.
A Chameleon that remains on a different color for more than one round will change itself to match that color.
The central cell is always considered to be the opposite color of the Chameleon that occupies it.
A Chameleon captures by jumping over an enemy Chameleon.
Multiple jumps are possible and capture of the initial piece is compulsory.
A player may choose not to capture all the enemy pieces in a string and stop jumping at any time.
The player that captures or converts all enemy Chameleons wins.

Name: The Game Of Tennis
Description:
The game of Tennis from National Games company. In this tennis game one uses  a die and a pawn to represent the tennis ball which players try to rally back and forth over the net. Throw too small a number, and your ball wouldn’t make it over the net. Too big a number, and you would overshoot the back line.

Published by the National Games Company which is credited to have been the first large-scale Australian manufacturer of locally-designed board games.

Recorded in the National Archives of Australia, where copyright registration and exhibit is dated 1924.

Name: Polis
Description:
"Card and Dice Game for 2-6 players. Greek City State Theme."

The players compete for control of ten Greek city states. The first player to control four cities or collect 100 victory tokens wins the game.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play.

Name: Phillips H. Lord's Gang Busters
Description: This game circa the 1930's was Law & Order type game with players playing either the good guys or the bad guys. The personality of each of the bad guys was different allowing for slightly different rules for each.

Name: Chronicles of Prince Valiant
Description:
A card game based on the Prince Valiant comic strip.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. The game requires a custom deck of approximately 120 cards and a set of coins or poker chips to use as Victory Tokens.

The deck is composed of seven types of cards: Trait, Plot, Location, Woman, Ally, Villain, and Foe. Players are awarded Victory Tokens for playing melds, with larger melds receiving more tokens. The first player to obtain ten Victory Tokens wins the game.

Name: New World Conquest
Description:
"Board and card game depicting the colonization of the Americas circa 1492-1760."

The players portray European powers (Spain, Portugal, France, England, and Holland) exploring the American continents. The map is randomly constructed during the course of play. Card play determines what actions a player can take each turn.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play the game. The components consist of an 8x5 grid board, 50 terrain tiles, approximately 170 cards, 39 Indian tribe counters, Gold tokens, and Victory Point tokens.

Name: Urbs Romana
Description:
"Tile laying game for 2-4 players. Players are constructing a city of the Roman Empire."

The game is played on an 8x8 grid board such as a standard chess board. During the course of the game the players fill the board with tiles representing different structures and resources found in a Roman city.

The players score points based on various factors, including tile type and location. Control markers are used to denote which player played a tile to aid in scoring.  The object is to have the most victory points once the board has been filled.

Name: The Stock Exchange
Description: A stock market manipulation game, in which players move around a board buying, selling and trading stocks. In addition to the usual fluctuation of share values and events (from the 'Bulls' and 'Bears' cards), the game introduces more sophisticated ideas such as buying and calling stock options, margin buying, and cornering the market.

Name: Battle of Camlann
Description:
"The last battle of King Arthur, where Arthur was mortally wounded and Mordred was slain. Card game for 2 Players."

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. The game is played using a custom deck of approximately 50 cards. The cards represent individual knights, weapons, magic, troops, events, traits, and mortal wounds.

A series of ten hands are played. The winner is the first player to win three hands in a row, win six of the ten hands, or to kill the opponent's leader.

Name: Anatolia 1000 BC
Description:
"War game for 2-6 players. Each player controls a civilization in the area of Asia Minor circa 1000 BCE. Each turn represents 10 years."

The players expand their competing civilizations across Asia Minor while amassing resources. Knowledge cards are purchased to help advance, benefit, or protect a player's civilization. Random event cards generate unexpected bonuses or catastrophes.

This is a free, online rules set which describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. Components include an area movement map of Asia Minor, seven sets of uniquely colored counters, six player resource mats, a victory point track consisting of 100 spaces, two custom decks of cards, and six and ten sided dice. An area movement map is available for download from the Warp Spawn site.

Name: Escalation
Description:
From the rules:

"Escalation is a game simulating political and military struggle during the cold war. The object of the game is to accumulate 20 VP by controlling Strategic Theatres. Competition on a Strategic Theatre could be started by triggering a local Crisis. Control over a Strategic Theatre could be gained using political means. Or, if you are a ruthless warmonger, you can make the guns roar. Or even start a nuclear weapon race."

Escalation is a print and play card game. Components include a custom deck of cards (composed of Crisis, Political, Special, and War Unit Cards) and a set of Strategic Theater boards (Europe, Middle East, Asia, Africa, North America, South America, U.N. Council, Sea Control, and Nuclear Weapons Race).

Name: The Olympic Game
Description: This trivia game is played in two stages: you compete first to acquire rings in the Olympic colours, then to acquire bronze and silver medals before winning. Questions are read from cards or, optionally, provided by a DVD with images, video clips and further reading. There are more than 2000 questions in all.

Name: Infinite City: Guild Hall and Salvage Yard
Description:
A mini expansion for the game Infinite City consisting of 6 new tiles: one Guild Hall tile and 5 Salvage Yard tiles.

The Guild Hall adds an end-game bonus for the player(s) controlling it and the Salvage Yard forces more turned over tiles onto the board (plus adds a little more interaction).

The Salvage Yard tiles are all similar in design and share the same text. However, one has a silver border and one is worth an extra 3 points.

Name: Empires in America: Expansion Kit
Description:
From the web site:

The Empires in America Expansion Kit includes the latest errata and plenty of new Optional Rules for the struggle for a continent in North America. Among its 24 additional cards are two additional French and two additional British Leaders, and plenty of new Action, Provincials, British and World Event cards to make the game's narrative much more compelling.

Optional Rules include: Fortress Garrisons, Leader Morale, Governing, and The Royal Navy. A special historical notes section includes Standing Orders: Rodgers' Rangers, and a commentary on those famous Standing Orders.

Game Components:


     One instructions sheet with new Optional Rules and Historical Notes
     Twenty-four new cards

Name: Attack! 7-8 Player Expansion
Description:
From the publisher's website:

The Attack! 7-8 player Expansion is a set of Black and White runners (both naval and land units) for the new rule set.

Please note: You need Attack! and Attack! Deluxe Expansion to use the Attack! 7-8 player Expansion.

Name: Cranium Dice Game
Description:
Players roll dice then flip a card that directs them to complete one of four different activities that incorporate the Cranium themed dice:

1. Complete sentences by spelling words with letters on rolled dice.
2. Doing simple math problems with numbers on dice.
3. Finding dice with specific pictures on them.
4. Creating a sculpture out of cards and dice.

Game was created for and sold exclusively through Starbucks during the 2009-2010 Holiday season

Name: Showdown! Battle Royal
Description:
Showdown! is a turn based card game. Each player starts with a leader that is out of play and five cards (max hand size). Two cards are drawn each turn and the players may play any number of soldiers and weapons on his/her turn. In order to attack another player's soldier he/she must have an attack card. The attacker chooses both his soldier and the target soldier and may disarm the target with a disarm card. The defender may respond at this point with a disarm if he/she has one. Each player in the fight rolls a die and adds up the bonuses from weapons, upgrades and one shot cards. The highest number wins with ties going to the defender. The loser may play a reroll card on his/her opponent if the player has one. Once three soldiers are in a players soldier discard pile, that players leader is in play and may attack. The leader may only be attacked if the player has no other soldiers out. Be the last one left with a leader in play and win the battle!

This card based battle game that will require both strategy and luck. Get ready to choose a side in this epic fight that will answer the question once and for all. Who's cooler?

This set combines Ninjas, Pirates, Knights and the Undead!

Play your soldiers! Protect your leaders! Equip them with weapons and accessories! Play attack cards on your opponents soldiers in order to clear the way to their leader. Roll the dice and add your bonuses and hope it's more than your opponent. He rolled a 6? Play your card that forces him to reroll! Why not disarm him before attacking next time? Do you have your base card that gives a bonus to all your soldiers? Find the weakest link and kick him while he's down!

Kill all your opponents leaders and be the last one standing to win!

Name: From Head to Toe
Description:
From publisher's website:

"Get your family moving with the Eric Carle From Head to Toe Game! This game develops a child's self-esteem and confidence. Players flip over cards to see who can do various moves with their bodies like Can You Wiggle Your Hips? Everyone who answers I Can Do It! does the action. This game encourages imagination as children act out images on the cards, and coordination as children learn to move all parts of their bodies."
Families: Series: World of Eric Carle (University Games)

Name: Classical Conquests
Description:
A game of ancient civilizations in conflict over the European continent and surrounding territories. "For 2-4+ players."

The players choose to play as one of 12 ancient civilizations of the region. Each civilization starts with two traits, such as arts, metallurgy, ship building, religion, etc. Traits provide certain resources or benefits. Traits can be developed and improved during the Research Phase.

Each territory on the map is marked with a type of resource. The distribution of the resources is randomly determined each game. Resources are used for various purposes, including supporting your civilization, building cities, and supporting research attempts.

This is a free, online rules set which describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. Components include an area movement map of Europe, a set of six tokens for each player (Armies, Fleets, Villages, Cities, Monuments, and Resources), a resource chart for each player, a common resource pool card, and six-, eight-, and twelve-sided dice. An area movement map is available for download from the Warp Spawn site.

Name: Imperialism
Description:
From the rules:

"Rule the world in the XIX Century"

"This is the XIX Century. Industrialism is growing ruthlessly, while both Armies and Navies are equipped with increasingly efficient weapons. The Minor Nations are deprived of their Resources by cunning Diplomats, while the Major Powers become richer and more powerful. Empires struggle for supremacy both in the Military and the Economy spheres."

"Gold, Blood and Iron will determine the ultimate Ruler of the World!"

Imperialism is a print and play card game. Components include a custom deck of cards (composed of Territory, Work, Army, Navy, and News Cards), Warehouse tabletop cards for each player, a TradeBoard tabletop card, and a sets of revenue, resource, and item tokens.

Name: Civ Builder
Description:
Two to four (or more) players represent one of ten world civilizations (Middle East, North Africa, India, China, Meso America, etc.)

Each civilization is rated for ten attributes (Conquest, Trade, Culture, Science, Agriculture, Religion, Sea, Government, Equestrian, and Engineering). The value of each attribute is randomly determined by rolling a die at the start of the game, with each civilization receiving a second cumulative die roll for a specified attribute in which that civilization excelled.

The gameplay involves drawing and trading cards in order to play melds. Playing a meld adds to a player's victory point total and increases the value of an attribute of the player's civilization. Playing a meld also conveys a specific bonus (such as stealing cards or victory points from other players) depending on the type of meld played. The winner is the player with the most victory points after twelve rounds have been played.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. The components include a custom card deck made up of twelve types of cards with nine copies of each card. Six-sided dice are also required for play.

Name: Warped Diplomacy Classic
Description:
A web-published board game of European conflict between the Great Powers. Inspired by the game Diplomacy.

From the publisher's website:

"Heavily modified variant of the board game Diplomacy. Card play replaces written orders. Players should be familiar with basic concepts of the standard game such as Supply Centers, Provinces, Units, and Great Powers. Special movement rules (Kiel & Constantinople, etc.) still apply. Rules for Retreats, Building, Occupation, Civil Disorder, and Convoys still work in the spirit of the original game."

"The standard game takes place in the relatively peaceful (historically) period between the Franco Prussian War (also Russo-Turkish) and WWI. However, it will be noticed that the card flavor of the Battle Decks in this variant has a distinctly WWI flavor."

Name: Paper Rails USA
Description:
"Rail Road Building Theme. Pen and Paper Game: No cards or dice needed. This is a modified PnP version of Railroad Dispatch USA."

The game is played on a map of the United States marked with cities. The players build rail connections by drawing lines between the cities. Building rail lines is one of the means of acquiring Victory Points. Additional Victory Points are scored when the player duplicates the circuit covered by historical rail lines.

The game adds additional flavor to this basic framework through the Income, Research, and Stock Points tracked for each player's railway. A series of Events can affect these point values as well, based on historical events that influenced nineteenth rail travel in the United States.

The Income, Research, and Stock Point values also serve to increase a player's Victory Point total. Victory Points can also be scored based on the type of commodities produced in the cities connected to a player's rail lines.

Materials required for play: Two pens with different colored ink, a coin, a printout of the game map, and a copy of the scoring tables.

Name: Patzam
Description:
Patzam is a sort of moving 3D Tic Tac Toe where you remove the middle piece each time you make a row. The goal of the game is to get rid of your pieces and be the first to have only 2 left.

Rules:
Alternately, both players place one piece on one of the 18 spots of the 3D-board. When all the pieces have been played, middle pieces of any rows of the same color are removed.
Then, players successively slide one piece in order to make a row (and remove the middle piece) or block the opponent.
The first player who has only 2 of his own pieces left on the board is the winner.

Name: Komikan
Description:
Komikan is a two-player abstract strategy board game from the Mapuches of Chile.

Rules
It is a hunt game using an expanded Alquerque board. Like all hunt games, there are two unequal forces at play. In Komikan, one player has only a single piece (usually called a "puma", "jaguar", "komikelu", "leon" or "ukuku"), which can move one space at a time or capture the other player's pieces by hopping over them.
The other player has twelve pieces (usually called "sheeps", "goats", "dogs" or "kukulis"), that can only move one space at a time, but not capture, and attempts only to surround and immobilize the puma or jaguar. All pieces must move and/or capture following the pattern on the board.

Board
The expanded Alquerque board consist of an Alquerque board and a triangular patterned board attached on one of its side. The sheeps or goats can also win the game by occupying every spaces on this triangle.
There are different triangular patterned board designs attached to the Alquerque board, and therefore Komikan has several variants. The standard triangular board has one horizontal line across the breadth of the triangle, and one vertical line along the length of the triangle.

According to Wikipedia, "Komikan may actually be the same game as Adugo."

Name: Vendemmia!
Description:
Players compete to purchase vineyards along the Italian peninsula.
By exploiting their own lands, they will produce wine with which they will realize the revenue necessary to develop their own activities.
Who will become the most famous?

The game is played in 6 turns.

Each turn is divided into 3 phases:  
1.    The arrangement of the turn
2.    The choice of actions
3.    The development of actions

The arrangement of the turn
Put 6 land cards on the table: get the first 4 from the stacks corresponding to the specific grape varieties. 
Get the last 2 from the shared deck. These will be the lands that can be purchased in the turn.
For the successive turns, update the prices increasing the highest price to 7 and use the same gap for all other prices.

The choice of actions
Every player starting from the first will be able to do some actions. There is only one limit to the actions that can be done in a turn: that is the money necessary to do them.
These actions, that can be found on the corresponding table of the game board, are:  
Modify the game order for the next turn    
Turn a land into a DOCG area (where DOCG stays for “Denomination of origin inspected and guaranteed”)
Benefit from the events
Purchase the lands revealed on the turn
Develop your own production capacity (quantity)
Develop your general productive quality
Make one of your vineyards productive    


The development of actions
All the actions choosed before will be acted in the game, in the exact order of them.


End of the game
The game ends at the end of the sixth turn.
In the last turn some bonus fame points will be distributed. 
More specifically: fame points to the player who has got more points on the bonus vine production, fame points to the player who has got more lands for each of the 4 macro-areas, fame points to the player with more money, fame point for each line of the technological development equal to 3.


The winner is who has got more fame points.

Name: Cross Purposes
Description: This game is played with a standard deck of cards. The novelty in this otherwise simple trick-taking game is that one of the players (partnerships) decides the trumps, then the other decides the top (for example if 8 is the top then the ranking order of cards from high to low is 8765432AKQJ109 in each suit).

Name: The Horror
Description:
The Horror is a turn based combat set in a world where a mob of horrifying creatures (zombies, skeletons, or whatever you want) have overrun the world and the remaining survivors are just trying to live another day. The game can be played solo or with a group of friends.

The game allows players to create and control a survior trying to make good his escape from the horror infested playing field.

The object of the game can be as simple as getting from side of the playing field to the other alive or as complex as completeing several objectives before being allowed to escape.

Name: Panzer Clash
Description:
Panzer Clash is a light, card-based wargame about Second World War Panzer battles for 2 - 4 players.

Pick a side, either Axis or Allies, and build a deck of 40 cards out of a pool of 100 different cards in order to defeat your enemey.
The deck or Supply contains Factories, Units, Events and Terrain Modifiers. Factories are needed to build Units and Terrain Modifiers as well as to power Events. Units and Events, which usually belong to one or more of the four factions (Germans, Japanese, Americans and Soviets) are used to attack and deal damage to the opponent, have certain beneficial effects on the game or are used to weaken the opponent. For each point of damage a Player receives through Units and Events, he or she puts one card from his or her Supply (deck) onto his or her Junkyard (discard-pile). Is a player unable to draw a card from the Supply, he or she loses immediately.

This game started out as a retheme of my fantasy card game Elemental Clash and ended up being so much more...

Very special thanks to my historic advisor Bruno Abreu!!

Name: Dracula
Description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards including two jokers. Both players are dealt four cards and a card is put face up on the table players put their cards so they form at the end of the round a 3x3 grid. Then one player scores for the vertical, the other for the horizontal lines. The score depends on the cards in the row, but cards with the same color or suit increases the value of a line.

More information, including a 3 and a 4-player variant can be found at http://parlettgames.uk/oricards/dracula.html

Name: Putt'n Score
Description: Up to three players control mini-golfers and try to putt their golf balls onto a rotating golf course that contains a water trap, sand trap, 4 greens (valued 2,3,4, & 5 points), and a windmill on a green in the center. Players try to earn the most points.

Name: Shocking Quiz
Description: A fantastic challenge for shockaholics or quiz addicts, Shocking Quiz lets you test your general knowledge with this 4 player multiple choice quiz game. And if you don’t know the correct answer to one of the 600 questions your in for a shock....quite literally!

Name: Formule Dé Circuit № 7: BRITISH GRAND PRIX – Silverstone Circuit
Description:
Seventh course for Formule DÃ© by LudodÃ©lire. The course was included in the britisch version of the game.

38" x 25"; 182 spaces; 8 corners (four "2"); straights 30, 22, 19; "2" corners at end of the two longest straights

RAIN : 1-7    VARIABLE : 8-13     FINE : 14-20

Name: Formule Dé Circuit № 8: GRAN PREMIO DE ESPAÑA – Circuit de Catalunya
Description:
Eight course for Formule DÃ© by Ludodélire.

36" x 12"; 174 spaces; 10 corners (one "2"); straights 40, 24; "2" corner is at end of longest straight and preceeds second-longest; lots of scenery-only space on the board but track is well packed and folds back on itself in the area it does occupy

LLUVIA : 1-4    VARIABLE : 5-10     SOL : 11-20

Name: Formule Dé Circuit 	№ 9: GRAND PRIX DU CANADA – Circuit Gilles Villeneuve
Description:
Ninth course for Formule DÃ© by Ludodélire.

40" x 14" (this oblong track is oriented along the diagonal); 127 spaces; 7 corners (four "2"s, all in a row); straights 18, 15, 14

PLUIE : 1-6    VARIABLE : 7-12     SOLEIL : 13-20

Name: Formule Dé Circuit 	№ 10: GRANDE PREMIO DE BRASIL – Circuito do Interlagos
Description:
Tenth course for Formule DÃ© by Ludodélire.

35" x 22"; 187 spaces; 7 corners (two "2"s); straights 59, 39, 22; one of the "2" corners separates the two longest straights

CHUVA : 1-3    VARIABLE : 4-8     SOL : 9-20

Name: Formule Dé Circuit № 11: JAPAN GRAND PRIX – Suzuka Circuit
Description:
Eleventh course for Formule DÃ© by Ludodélire.

42" x 13"; 148 spaces; 6 corners (one "3", two "2"s); straights 35, 21, 19, 18; longest straight starts & ends with "2" corners

RAIN : 1-5    VARIABLE : 6-13     FINE : 14-20

Name: Fantasy Heroes Skirmish
Description:
"RPG-like card game for 2 players, based on [Lloyd] Krasner's Superhero Slugfest Card Combat rules."

"Each player gets one deck. A deck represents a party of adventurers, all its members, and all of their special abilities. A party has 6 Members. A deck has 60 cards."

"Each hero is represented by 10 cards: Five of these are Character cards. The five character cards have a Force value and the name of the hero. The other five are Ability cards. The five ability cards have a Force modifier and the name of the hero which belongs to."

The players fight a series of battles through card play. To win the game you must kill or wound all 10 of your opponent's heroes.

This free, online rules set describes the components that you will need to create in order to play. Rules and print-and-play components are available on the Yahoo group Fermwarp.

Name: Formule Dé Circuit № 12: SOUTH of AFRICA GRAND PRIX – Kyalami Circuit
Description:
Twefth course for Formule DÃ© by Ludodélire.

38" x 17"; 152 spaces; 8 corners (two "2"s); straights 21, 18 (pit), 18, 14, 14; longest straight starts with "2" corner
RAIN : 1-6        VARIABLE : 7-11        FINE : 12-20

Name: Formule Dé Circuit № 13: SAN MARINO – Autodromo Enzo & Dino Ferrari
Description:
Thirteenth course for Formule DÃ© by Ludodélire.

43" x 19" (diagonally oriented); 146 spaces; 8 corners (two "2"s); straights 20, 17, 14, 11, 11, 11; longest (pit) straight ends with "2" corner

PLUIE : 1-7       VARIABLE : 8-13         SOLEIL : 14-20

Name: GolfEgo
Description:
Taken from the official website:

Golf Board Game: GolfEgo™
...... a great way to play the game

GolfEgo is fun! It's easy to understand and play, whether you're a regular golfer or not.

Now everyone can play a round of golf, young and old and right at home. And just as exciting as the real game!

GolfEgo™ is an innovative board game based on golf. Like when you are playing outside on the green, this board game is a challenge to your Ego. Play 9, 18 or just a few holes. Create your own rules, or play one of the available games like stroke play, match play, skins or fun golf, a kind of Ludo...

The 4 pawns represent the players and have been designed just for this game, and so are the 4 dices which are the virtual clubs in your bag. So with GolfEgo™ you can decide which one to use. Playing safe or taking a risk, just like the real thing!

The game itself:
Much attention has been given to detail. Inside the colourful box there is a nicely designed board which covers 18 holes (9 holes each side). The board features ponds, bunkers and greens. It even has a clubhouse! Of course the box is delivered to you with dices, pawns and a notebook for writing down the scores.

Name: Old Janx Spirit
Description:
Old Janx Spirit is a Decktet rummy game for 2 players.
Each player is dealt a hand of ten cards,the remaining cards become the draw pile.
On each turn draw one card and discard one card.
When all ten cards are part of melds the round ends and you score one point.

Link to wiki article: http://wiki.decktet.com/game:old-janx-spirit

Name: Trafik-monopol
Description:
A Swedish game where you move a traffic sign around a board, face traffic-based events and answer related questions. No one is very sure why traffic signs would need to know about these things. It's not a Monopoly clone but shares some minor visual elements, presumably in order to ride on Monopoly's popularity.

NOTE: While traditionally credited as a Kärnan game it is more likely that the real publisher is moped and bicycle manufacturer Monark AB and that this is an advertising object. Please note how the persons and bikes are introduced on the box lid. (Kärnan is however the manufacturer of the game.) In the years between 1945 and around 1960 (when the automobile become common) the moped and bicycle markets in Sweden was heated with fierce competition between Monark, Nymans, Husqvarna and other manufacturers. Monark would eventually "win the race" and swallow the closest competitors, first Nymans and then in 1962 Husqvarna's divisions for bicycles, mopeds and boat engines.

Name: Trafik-Snurran
Description: Swedish educational trivia game about traffic rules with a "magic robot"-style device for revealing the correct answers.

Name: Golden Gate
Description:
Open up that Golden Gate! Its up to your wits, and a little bit of luck, to make the right plays and pile up the points.

Set down cards in number order. A yellow card means you take a chip out of the Golden Gate. Here’s where you show off your skills…can you place them at the right times to get the best chips? Or will the opportunity pass you by? And don’t get stuck with red cards, or you’ll lose chips.

It’s a fast, friendly showdown for the gold with the fine craftsmanship and colorful designs you’ve come to expect from Blue Orange Games.

Name: PigzUp!
Description:
How quick and precise are your fingers? Find out as you build piggy piles in this thrilling stacking game.
 When two cards match, players race to construct a tower of piggies that is tops of the sty! Be careful! There are rules to how you can stack them. And your pile must stand up with the right number and color. Run out of cards and you are king of the pen.

Players will be on the edge of their seats and will take like pigs to mud as they shout "Pigzup!"

Name: PeekPoker
Description:
PeekPoker is a fast-paced and fun dice version of its cousin, Texas Hold’em Poker.

Players use 3 dice hidden inside their see-through cup and 3 community dice to make their combinations.

Think you’ve got a good hand? Make a bet and get the chance to snag your opponents’ chips. And beware of bluffers... they’ll fill you with doubt!

Make a bet and get the chance to snag your opponents’ chips.

Name: Thalatha
Description:
A 2 player game play on a 3 by 3 grid.  Each player has 3 stones and the object is to get 3 stones in a row (not diagonal.)  Once a player has placed his three stones he moves one of his stones on his turn.

There is a note that comes with the game that says this game was taught to the publisher by an Iraqi boy while he was serving in Iraq.  They played this game in the sand with stones.

Name: Kremlin: Destalinization Expansion
Description:
A 1953 variant for Kremlin posted in The General Vol.31,No.2.  that included 5 new intrigue cards reflecting the political situation of the 1950's.  This expansion was meant to be played with the basic Kremlin game and the "Revolution" expansion.

The cards and scenario in this set allow for picking up after Stalin leaves the scene.

Name: Ganderpoke
Description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards (including jokers and/or removing cards, depending on the number of players). 25 cards are put face-down on the table, forming a 5x5 square. A player in his turn takes any face-down card from the square, adds it to his hand, and fill the gap with any card from his hand face up.

When all the cards in the square are face up, the value of the square counted according to the Poker combinations in the rows and columns. Then each player chooses five cards from his hand; the player with the best Poker combination scores twice the value of the square, the player with the worst Poker combination scores the value of the square.

Name: Galapagos
Description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards. The game consists of three phases as follows:

1. Melds. In Phase 1 you both try to improve your hands by bidding for new cards from the stock. When none remain in stock, you score for any melds (card combinations) contained in your revised hands. This phase is rather like Gops.

2. Tricks. In Phase 2 you play out your revised hands to 13 tricks, aiming especially to win an odd number of tricks (1, 3, 5 etc). This phase is rather like Piquet.

3. Play-off. Finally, you each pick up as a new hand the 13 cards you used for bidding in the first phase, and aim to be the first to play out all the cards from your hand. This phase is rather like Arsehole / President / Trouduc.

Name: Hamlet
Description: This game is played with a standard deck of cards stripped down to AKQJT987 plus one Joker. Eleven tricks are played, hence one player will win either the middling number of tricks, or, if two win the same number, a unique number of tricks. That player is designated Hamlet. A new trump suit and a scoring multiplier (whether it is more desirable "to be or not to be" Hamlet) are decided at the start of each round.

Name: Waba: 4 Denk – Und Legespiele
Description:
WABA
The players try to connect opposing sides of the gameboard. There's a two player and a three player version. Two players each have 40 pieces, three players each have 30 pieces. 
The first move for each player is to place a piece on the startline. From that position a continuous line is to be formed. After the first move players may place a piece on every field on the board that is unoccupied by a piece of the adversaries.
When all pieces have been played and no line connecting the opposing sides of the board is formed, the game ends in a draw.

WABEN-HALMA
Waben-Halma is a two player game. Each has 15 pieces to be placed in the 'Waben-triangle' at the base of the board. The object is to be the first player to have moved all 15 pieces in the starttriangle of the opponent. The rules of this game are exactly like Halma.

DREIER-WABEN
This is a game for two or three players. Each players has 15 pieces. Every turn one piece is to be placed on the board. The object is to be the player who has formed the largest number of triangle formations on the board. Such triangle formations contain three pieces of the same colour in pyramid form.

WABEN-BILDER
Waben-Bilder is a game of shape building. Each player tries to form a certain figure (a flower, house, key etc.) on the board. The first to complete such a figure wins the game.

Name: Dave Dawson Pacific Battle Game
Description: Dave Dawson was the lead character in a number of books, called "The War Adventure Series" written by Robert Sidney Brown from 1942 - 1946. A couple of those books were converted to board games. This is one of those games and is based on the story in the book "Dave Dawson with the Pacific Fleet"

Name: Dave Dawson Victory Game
Description: Dave Dawson was the lead character in a number of books, called "The War Adventure Series" written by Robert Sidney Bowen from 1942 - 1946. A couple of those books were converted to board games. This is one of those games and is based on the story in the book "Dave Dawson with the Commandos"

Name: The Original Home Jai-Alai Game
Description: Only game published by Design Origin, done in 1984 and of course based on the game of Jai-Alai known as the fastest sport in the world.

Name: Hamburger Cardgame
Description:
Players get 6 cards and must create hamburgers with more points than opponents. Every turn they may change 1 card and must open 1 component in front of them. If all hamburgers are completed scoring takes place and player with the most points is winner.

Components:
52 cards

Name: Flip-'n-Stack Tiki Island
Description:
Game consists of a metal, two-sided board; a teeter-totter launching platform; and 6 little Tiki statue figures -- 3 blue and 3 green -- each with strong magnets in their hands and feet. The blue and green figures are of opposite polarity.

Play is simple:
1. Place tiki on launcher.
2. Place launcher close to the metal board.
3. Place finger on launcher and press.

The figure flips into the air and hopefully lands on the the board. The magnets are strong enough that generally the tiki will right itself vertically (either right-side up or upside down). You alternate colors in hopes of forming a stack of figures.

Score is based on where the figures land on the island depicted on the board and how high the stacks are.

The reverse side of the board contains a dartboard-like target.

Name: Last Battle for Germany
Description:
From publisher's website:
In 1989, the governments of eastern Europe fell leading to an end of the Warsaw Pact. The Soviet leadership surrendered to the political and economic realities they faced. Events could have been different. Last Battle for Germany is a simulation of a military climax of the Cold War. The game is played against a backdrop of unknown political and military events over which the players have no control, but to which they must react. Players maneuver their divisions, brigade and regiments across a map with 15 kms per hex during turns representing 48 hour. An innovative game system represents each subordinate commander's headquarters and support assets. An integrated air game completes this definitive simulation of a Warsaw Pact-NATO conflict.

Name: TriForce
Description:
From publisher's website:
TriForce is an innovative strategy game offers wargaming in an exciting science-fiction format. Move one-inch playing pieces containing futuristic forces to capture key areas of the board. Combat is resolved with a unique dice roll system. The board features oversized hexagons with dramatic colors instead of terrain. All of the basic wargaming concepts are here in a game you can play with anyone.

Name: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
Description: Invasion of the Body Snatchers is a party game for 8-21 players based off of the popular Mafia and Werewolf games. One of the players is secretly an alien invader in a human body and is turning the citizens of Lake Terror into pod people one by one. Can the town find and lynch the alien menace before it's too late? It won't be easy, but you will have fun finding out.

Name: Memini
Description:
This game is played with two standard decks of cards. One of them is dealt to the players evenly (the remaining cards remain face down). Then everyone has half minute to memorize his cards. Then the cards from the other pack are revealed one at a time, and players can claim they have the matching pair among their cards.

After going through the deck every player scores 1 point for his card if he card alone claimed it, and p points if it was claimed by someone else as well, where p is the number of players.

Name: The Safety Belt Game
Description:
Published by the U.S. Department of Transportation to promote the use of seat belts.  Each player rolls a die and moves along a track.  the first player to get the amusement park wins.

Some spaces are marked with hazards that cause the loss of a turn.  Other spaces cause the player to get out the car.  When movement resumes, a Safety Belt card must be drawn.  If the player forgets to do this, a turn is lost.  There are two exits, which if landed on, can shorten the trip.

It is a game for children who don't mind being preached to while playing.

Name: Minimisère
Description:
This game is played with a part of a standard deck of cards. Depending on the number of players, some cards are removed. Then tricks are played. The uniqueness of the game is that the score depends  on the number of tricks won in a strange way. For example with five players there are five tricks, and the score is 1 for winning 1 trick, 2 for 2 tricks, 5 for 0 tricks, 6 for 3 tricks, 8 for 4 tricks and 0 for 5 tricks.

More information can be found at https://www.parlettgames.uk/oricards/minimis.html

Name: Landsraad
Description:
From the rulebook:

"Intrigue, trade and war in the Dune universe."

"Dune's universe, between the advent of Muad'Dib. Political, economic and military struggle between the Noble Houses of the Imperium. Meddle in politics during the Landsraad Council, influencing the Padishah Emperor. Acquire wealth, speculating on Semuta Drug and Pundi Rice prices in the CHOAM. Plan hostile actions against rivals, under the limitations of the Great Convention."

Components:

"The game is conducted on 3 boards: on the LANDSRAAD board you can plan political actions; on the CHOAM board you can trade resources for SOLARI (the Imperium currency); on the KANLY board you can plan assassinations, sabotage actions, or even full-scale wars."

"Tokens represent commodities (SPICE MELANGE, HAGAL QUARTZ, etc.), or SOLARI (the Imperium currency). Also, there are tokens to represent three NOBLES for each Noble House, and for their soldiers (TROOPERS, SABOTEURS and ASSASSINS). Also there are tokens to represent the special ADVISORS (Mentat or Bene Gesserit) which you could be provided if you met the Emperor's favour."

"Cards represent useful situations which could help you during your quest for power. The most powerful ones are you cannot obtain by chance: they are PETITIONS to the Padishah Emperor which he has graciously agreed to concede (or, sometimes, not to concede). Less powerful situations are just acts of FATE."

Gameplay summary:

"Each player will represent a Noble House and will be given three NOBLE tokens: he will use those tokens to attempt actions in each turn. Actions could be political (LANDSRAAD board), trade (CHOAM board) or hostile (KANLY board): to represent that a player is attempting an action, he will put one of his NOBLE in the appropriate slot on the appropriate board. The number of action a player could do in a turn will be therefore generally limited by the NOBLE tokens he has, even if it will be possible to increase it by mean of ADVISORS."

"Each turn is divided in three phases: LANDSRAAD, CHOAM and KANLY; each to be played on the appropriate board."

Victory:

"When a player will draw the End Game Fate Card, he will immediately show it, and the game will end. The Noble house with the most SOLARI will win the game."

Name: ArchCriminal
Description:
From the rulebook:

"Ever wondered what is it like to be a Super Evil Villain Mastermind attempting to take over the world, scheming twisted plots in his Hidden Lair? Now you can be one."

"In order to win the game you have to CONQUER THE WORLD!!!! BWHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!!!!!!! At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt three Objective Cards at random, which are to be kept secret. In order to CONQUER THE WORLD!!!! you have to fulfil your three objectives."

In this tongue-in-cheek game, the players are evil super-villains operating from secret lairs scattered around the globe. The players send out their lowly Minions who perform acts of infamy around the world and attempt to recruit new Minions.

Name: Ximaera
Description:
Ximaera is played on a 3x3 hexagonal board.
There are,off board,sets of three stones for four different types(a total of 12 stones).The stones of one type are called pivots.All stones are neutral and can be used by either player.
On each turn,each player must drop or move one stone.
Pivots may also jump over an adjacent stone.
A player wins by:
1.Connecting three stones of the same kind.
2.If he has no valid move.
3.Opponent repeats a board position for the third time.

Name: Dungeon Keeper Unofficial Card Game
Description:
From the rulebook:

"So You Want to Become a Dungeon Keeper? Want to Create a Dark Underground Fortress and fill it with Wicked Minions? Want to Create an Evil Empire, bringing Chaos, Death and Destruction? Want to Bash pitiful, useless Heroes? Welcome to the Unofficial Dungeon Keeper Card Game."

"You've got lands (Rooms). You've got Creatures. You've got 20 LifePoints. Just like in magic. Different Rooms are needed to Summon more Creatures, or to research Spells or to build Artifacts, and in general to be more Powerful."

"But there's come the fun part. Creatures can't be anywhere: they must be In a Room. To represent this, you need to put your Creatures near the Rooms they're in. A creature in a Room can defend it, but cannot defend a different Room . . . So be wary not to expand your Dungeon too much, or you will be unable to defend it."

"A Creature in a Room can also use the Room. So, for example, your Warlock in your Library will be able to research a Spell (or to defend the Library). If you want him to defend the Lair, instead, you can move him in the Lair (in the appropriate Turn Phase), but then he will be unable to research a Spell (as he need to be in the Library to do so)."

"You can win in two ways: 1) Kill the Avatar when he's attacking your Dungeon (The World Will Be Mine! Victory), 2) Kill the other Dark Lord (BWHAHA ! Victory)."

Name: Speculation: The Dynamic Real Estate Auction Game
Description:
Speculation is an auction and strategy game for 2-6 players, built around property acquisition in a metropolitan area. The object of the game is to amass the greatest wealth through property ownership. Players first compete in an auction to purchase options on the various properties. An option gives a player the right to purchase a property, if they can mameuver the token around the board to their property. Since all players maneuver the same token, each player can try to prevent the other players from exercising their options. A player receives from the bank when he moves the token over one of their own properties, and receives from the other players when they move the token over one of his properties. At the end of the game, the player with the greatest amount of money plus property value is declared the winner.

The game ends when the last option is exercised. Any player may exercise the last option, regardless of who holds the option.

Name: Uups! Sag's nicht!
Description: Taboo variant with cards of different difficulty level (marked in different colors) which yield 1-4 points. Also, each team gets an individual difficulty level, determined by the number of taboo words. The cards are put into a box in which a number of openings can be cleared to display the taboo words (1-4). Thus, the game can be played by adults and kids together (giving the kids less taboo words to worry about). Game ends when a team has reached a premeditated number of points.

Name: American Gladiators: The Wall
Description:
American Gladiators - The Wall is a dexterity game based on the American Gladiators television series. It was produced by Taco Bell and given away in its kids meals.
Players take turns flicking gladiator discs at a wall trying to knock off contestants.

Name: 天空盤 (Tenkuban)
Description:
The Japanese name Tenkuban (å¤©ç©ºç›¤) roughly corresponds to "Sky Board"; this is a version of the game "Ghosts!"

Each player controls 4 angels and 4 devils on 6x6 board, their identities hidden from the opponent.

A player can win by:

     moving an angel into a goal square from the corners of the opponent's side;
     capturing all 4 of the opponent's angels; or
     tricking the opponent into capturing all 4 of the player's devils.


Players deploy their pieces and then take turns moving one to an adjacent square. They may capture enemy pieces but do not know whether it is an angel or devil until after the capture.

Dartslive Co., Ltd produced 3 versions of the board game in different materials (cardboard, clear acrylic, & stainless steel), as well as a mobile phone version.

Name: KulturVision Graz
Description:
The basic concept of this game is similar to Monopoly: Roll and move, buy fields and build extensions, pay if you step on other people's land. The dice mechanism is different, though: The fields are not lined up in a row, but all over the board, and the die rolls (one color die, one number die) determine the direction and distance in which a player moves.
There are several variants to this game, which include trivia aspects, a timed variant, etc.

Name: König Kasimir und seine Tiere
Description:
Game for the very young that comes with rules variants for 1-3 year olds (!). 
In the simplest form, a kind of nursery rhyme is read out and the kids can sort the animals in the same order they appear in the rhyme.
In another game, the players roll a die and move the animal they rolled to the end of the line behind the queen. The goal is to complete the row of all eight animals.

Name: Geo200
Description: The game consists of cards for 193 countries plus 7 special cards. The country cards contain pictures of the flags, the flags of the neighboring countries and some other information. There are various games which can be played with this material; most notably trick-taking games in which the players can form "alliances" by playing cards of neighboring countries together, which makes the cards stronger.

Name: Jogo Mulan
Description:
Jogo Mulan is a roll-and-move race-to-the-finish board game based on the cartoon, Mulan. The board depicts fifty-seven spaces that players have to move through to get to the finish. If players land on specially-coloured spaces, they refer to the instruction sheet (which comes in both Portuguese and Spanish) to see what happens to them (e.g. miss a turn, move to another space).

The game was published by Trisan Editores, a Portuguese entertainment media company.

Name: Alley Up
Description: This is a simple bowling game from the William Bruce Company. It features wooden dice that either have a blank face or a pin on them. You roll the dice and see what you have for pins remaining and then shoot for your spare. This game has similarities to other bowling type games from different companies and different publishing years.  Games like Spare Time Bowling, Bowling Dice, Bowl and Score, or Bowl - A - Strike are similar types games and their may be others already in the DB.

Name: Party Brawl
Description:
Party Brawl is a satirical expansion to Wizard published in The Space Gamer (Issue 22 - Mar 1979). The core rules to Wizard are not included but required for play.

The player collects points for sex and machismo by dancing, drinking beer, arguing, or fighting. He might lose consciousness or throw up depending on his actions.

Name: Kunskapsjakten
Description:
Kunskapsjakten is a trimmed-down reimplementation of NE-spelet with 4,000 new questions compared to 8,000 in the original game. As before, players move around the board and answer questions to assemble trophies (a miniature encyclopaedia) representing ten fields of knowledge.

"Kunskapsjakten" is also the name of a single book of 1,000 additional questions, a series of books each containing 500 questions, and an online feature where you can score points by answering timed questions (Swedish only).

Name: L'Eclissi di Zama
Description:
"L'Eclissi di Zama" is the second wargame published by the Italian games shop "Stategia e Tattica", the first having been "Il Sole di Austerlitz" (Austerlitz's Sun). Both were published on the occasion of public events.

The game system, as the "Il Sole di Austerlitz", takes inspiration from "Napoleon's Last Battles", and has about the same hex size while units are equivalent to a regimental size.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Cutthroat Caverns: Hex Room Promo Card
Description:
The promo card "Hex Room" was handed out at the Smirk & Dagger booth at GenCon 2009.  It is an encounter card for the game Cutthroat Caverns that pays homage to one of Smirk & Dagger's other games, Hex Hex.

Text on the card is as follows:

NON-COMBAT Encounter - No attack cards are 'Set'.
Give Player #1 any token to represent the Hex.  The player with the Hex must play an Attack card from his hand.  If the first digit of the attack value is Even, pass the Hex to the Right.  If Odd, pass to the Left.  If 0, pass to any Player.  'Trip' & 'Critical Miss' will cancel any Attack card.  'Not So Tough' can be used to alter an attack value and change the Hex direction.  If at any time you cannot play a card with an attack value, you are hexed.  The Hexed player must draw an Initiative Card.  
1) Lose 20 Life.  The Player who sent you the Hex gains 10 Life.
2) Remove all your Items from the game.
3) Get a (-3) Prestige token.
4) Permanently reduce your hand size by one.
5) Get a (-5) Prestige token.
6) Gain 3 Prestige and 20 Life.

Name: Hornet Hoops
Description:
A 2 player or solitaire card game based on BASKETBALL.   Scrimmage your friends and pick the right combination of players.  Get your team all playing the same offense and defense for maximum points scored!

Start your game with a "Jump Ball" and keep your players from fouling out so they can shoot "Free Throws", "Jump Shots", and especially "3 Pointers".

With characters from the Mid-Michigan Central Montcalm Lady Hornets Baketball team.  45 card deck included.  A quick and easy to learn card game made for basketball players by a coach.  This game is played at school and on bus trips by high school basketball teams.

Name: Braggadocio
Description:
Players decide on a grand story about who they are and may improve their story by utilizing their story telling skills and over-acting the character they are trying to portray.
As you tell your story, you will be challenged by other players to work some of their "TOPIC TILES or TOPIC CARDS" (depending on the version you have) in to your current story. If you are able to, you will make money (chips), but if not, you will lose coins. Your goal is to make it as hard as possible for the other players to work your topics in to their story by giving them the most challenging topics. Players are guided by their TOPIC cards which they find easy to explain and use for themselves, or tough to imagine an explanation, so they challenge another player which can help you earn extra money or lose it to great story tellers.   Some cards contain blanks which you get to fill in to make your topics as challenging as possible.

The quickest minds & most boastful of your group will certainly have an advantage!

The game is concluded when all players vote with their coins and decide who the best story teller was. A great game or activity for acting classes, drama clubs, scouting or camping activities or other educational purposes.

Name: Learn about the Home Front
Description: The game is intended to teach children about life during World War II in the United Kingdom.  Players move around the board and read facts on the squares.  There are three types of interactive squares:  "News Bulletin," "Read all about it," and "Quick on the Draw."  The first two give facts and instruct the player to move forward or back, while the "Quick on the Draw" square gives the player a chance to interact with other players and show off their drawing skills in return for a reward of moving forward in the game.
